description: Review supplier data for completeness and data quality.

scenario_name: Edit Company Accounting Options related to Procurement
description: Ensure company accounting options related to procurement are configured correctly:  Procurement Tax Options:  Calculate Tax Due to Supplier Enter Tax Due to Supplier or Calculate Self Assessed Taxes
task_step: Related Action From Company > Edit Company Accounting Details > Update the Tax Option Default

description:
Ensure company procurement options are configured correctly. Take special note of the following:  
1) Will customer be implementing Sales Tax on Requisitions? (Enable/Disable Transaction Tax on Requisition Flag) 
2) Does customer wish to hide Service lines on Requisitions? (Enable/Disable Disable Service Lines on Requisitions Flag)  
3) Does customer wish to hide Project lines on Requisitions? (Enable/Disable Disable Project-Based Service Lines on Requisitions Flag)
task_step: Related Action From Company > Edit Company Procurement Options

description: Review all units of measure and identify any that need to be added. Be sure to consider punchout suppliers UOM if punchout is in scope.

Cart link overrides allow you to hide requisition selections that do not apply to your organization's deployment of Workday Procurement and/or add instructional text to help guide your end users. Make sure text displayed will help users who will be creating requisitions.
task_step: Create Requisition or View Cart (Options listed are the Cart Links)

description: Add any instructions or links to policies for the requisition process.
Review the contract types and feature configurations and identify any adjustments needed.

Review the delivered layout and ensure the layout is configured for each company. If custom layout is in scope, review this custom layout once it is built by integrations team. "View Purchase Order Print Layout" will show you the functional configuration, but it is easier to view the actual result by creating a PDF and issuing it to Print and then viewing the PDF created.
task_step: View Purchase Order Print Layout or Create Purchase Order>Issue Purchase Order>Print

description: Review return reasons and identify which ones should auto-generate the invoice adjustment process.
Review the requisition types. Requisition types are used for sourcing rules or as a dimension in BP logic.
If punchout is in scope, review the punchout links once they are configured. Ensure that only the allowed users can see the link when entering a requisition.

Review the match rule set and each of the condition rules in the rule set. Ensure that there are no gaps in the rules that would enable an invoice to get through without a second set of eyes reviewing the differences between the invoice and its associated PO.
task_step: View Supplier Accounts Match Rule Set

description: Verify the following rules have the correct ledger account: Spend, Credit Card Payable, Receipt Accrual

Verify all required Custom Validations have been configured for (depending on scope): Catalog Load, Change Order, Procurement Card Transaction Verification, Purchase Order Acknowledgement, Request for Quote, Request for Quote Award, Request for Quote Response, Requisition, Return to Supplier, Supplier, Supplier Change, Supplier Contract, Supplier Contract Amendment

Confirm that these Role Based Security Roles for Procurement have been properly assigned or are defaulting to each Company (depending on scope): Buyer, Supplier Contract Specialist, Procurement Data Entry Specialist

Run User-Based Security Group Assignments report and Verify that these user Based Security Roles for Procurement have been properly assigned: Procurement Configurator, Accounts Payable Configurator, Credit Card Transaction Administrator
Verify all required Worktag Usages have been configured for: Procurement Card Transaction Verification, Purchase Order, Request for Quote, Requisition
Review the Maintain Related Worktag usage for: Purchase Item, Spend Category
Create a requisition and submit for approval. Verify that approval routing works as expected.
Approve Requisition. Test Business Process routing based on the configured conditions for each Business Process step.

description: Review default Business Process for Requisitions. Ensure any discussed modifications are included.

Issue purchase orders.

description: Create a receipt for goods or services that have been received. Note: You can only do this once PO is issued.
task_step: Create Receipt or Related Action from the Purchase Order > Receipt > Create
workday_role: Buyer / Employee As Self / Business Asset Tracking Specialist

scenario_name: Create a Receipt with Line Splits by Quantity
description: Create a receipt with line splits by quantity. Note: You can only do this once PO is issued.  Note that this assumes Assets is being implemented along with Procurement.   Further note that unless asset shares is enabled, the Asset will be Expensed. If assets shares is enabled, Accounting Treatment will be derived by Asset Book Rules.
task_step: Create Receipt or Related Action from the Purchase Order > Receipt > Create
workday_role: Buyer / Employee As Self / Business Asset Tracking Specialist

scenario_name: Create a Receipt with Line Splits by Amount
description: Create a receipt with line splits by amount. Note: You can only do this once PO is issued.  Note that this assumes Assets is being implemented along with Procurement.  Further note that unless asset shares is enabled, the Asset will be Expensed. If assets shares is enabled, Accounting Treatment will be derived by Asset Book Rules.
task_step: Create Receipt or Related Action from the Purchase Order > Receipt > Create
workday_role: Buyer / Employee As Self / Business Asset Tracking Specialist

description: Create a partial receipt. Note: You can only do this once PO is issued.
task_step: Create Receipt or Related Action from the Purchase Order > Receipt > Create
workday_role: Buyer / Employee As Self / Business Asset Tracking Specialist

description: Create an over-receipt. Note: You can only do this once PO is issued.  Note that this can ONLY be done once per Accounting period
task_step: Create Receipt or Related Action from the Purchase Order > Receipt > Create
workday_role: Buyer / Employee As Self / Business Asset Tracking Specialist

description: Create a return for items that are damaged or if too many were sent by the supplier. Note: You can only do this once PO is issued.

scenario_name: Create an Invoice Adjustment for a Return
description: Create an invoice adjustment to increase or decrease liability.
task_step: Create Invoice Adjustment or if your return reasons have the "invoice adjustment" checkbox checked, then the return will automatically kick of the invoice adjustment creation process

scenario_name: Create an Invoice from the Workbench
description: Create an invoice from the workbench in order to create it directly from receipts (3 way matching) or POs (2 way matching).
task_step: Supplier Invoice Workbench > Add lines from receipt (if 3 way matching) / Add lines from purchase order (if 2 way watching) / Add lines from supplier contract > Scroll down to the middle of the page and click "search." Check the lines of the records that you want to add > Click "Complete Supplier Invoice"

description: Create a return for items that are damaged or if too many were sent by the supplier. Note: You can only do this once PO is issued.

description: Create a partial return. Note: You can only do this once a receipt was created.

scenario_name: Schedule Purchase Order Close Lines for Receiving
description: Schedule Purchase Order Close Lines for Receiving
task_step:
This task can be scheduled or run Ad Hoc
Run Now
Request Name - Enter name
Company - Enter Company from Purchase Order
Supplier - Enter Supplier from Purchase Order
Minimum Purchase Order Age in Days = 0
Requisition Type = Inventory Replenishment

Restrict to PO lines with Zero Shipped Quantities = Y
Restrict to PO lines with Partially Received Quantities = N

We only want to process purchase orders that has an associated ASN with a Quantity Shipped = 0 . Partially received purchase will not be processed.

scenario_name: Exclude Purchase Orders from Mass Close
task_step:
Using existing Purchase Orders, test the Exclude from Close, the remove the exclusion to enable purchase order to be closed through the Mass Close process. 

Purchase orders need to be in the following status to be updated:
In Progress
Approved
Issued

description: Find Purchase Item
task_step: Identify a "primary item" that you will associate a Substitute Item for.

description: Edit Purchase Item
task_step:
Item Substitutes tab

Ordering Start Date - "correct date"
Ordering End Date - "end of substitute use or leave blank"

Deliver to Location - enter a specific Deliver to location that this substitute will be used for. 

Substitute Priority = 1
Item Substitute = Enter a substitute item for your "Primary Item"
Usage = Procurement

Submit

**Note the Deliver to Location - this will be used on the Requisition.

description: Requisition Sourcing Rules
Create Requisition
task_step:
Enter Requisition - input all data 
Deliver to - enter specific deliver to that was configured in the Substitute Item setup
OK

Search Catalog - Search for "Primary" item
Check the checkbox next to the item
Add to Cart

Click on "View Cart" - Shopping Cart
Checkout
Verify information 
Submit

**Note Requisition ID

Process requisition through any approvals.

description: Source Requisitions
task_step:
Company - Select Company from Requisition
Requisition - Enter Requisition ID
Search

Check the Checkbox next to the Requisition ID
OK
Submit

You will now see an Alert - The item selected has substitution ordering dates at this time. For more information, review the Item Substitute tab on the View Purchase Item report for the selected item.

You can "Submit" the requisition again, but the Substitute will not occur.

To select the Substitute Item - In the Item field Substitutes for Requested Items -> Select the Substitute Item 
Submit

description: Find Purchase Order
task_step:
Company - Enter company from Requisition
Document Date On or After - Date of Test
Requisition - Enter requisition ID
OK

Click on Spyglass to view the Purchase Order
Verify the item is the Substitute Item

description: Issue Purchase Order
task_step:
From the related action from the PO ID -> Purchase Order -> Issue
OK

Verify Purchase Order is "Issued"

description: Create Receipt
task_step:
From the Related action from the PO ID -> Receipt -> Create Receipt
PO should default in 
OK

Fully Receive
Submit

** If this PO / Receipt was to be putaway into an Inventory Site - Ensure auto putaway ran.

description: Create a requisition as an ad hoc request.
Approve Requisition. Test Business Process routing based on the configured conditions for each Business Process step.
Fulfillment Source = Purchase Order  Put in a Supplier  Click OK
Open requisition.  On Requisition line, Purchase Order number should be in "sourced" column. Click on it to open the Purchase Order  If not in Approved Status, Submit for Approval
task_step: 4. View Purchase Order created from Requisition

description: Approve Purchase Order. Test Business Process routing based on the configured conditions for each Business Process step.
Issue a purchase order and print.
task_step: 6. Issue a Purchase Order and Print

description: Login as user who created Req. Go to Purchases Dashboard (add if not displayed) and find link to Create Receipt  At Create Receipt screen, put in Purchase Order, Select "Fully Receive" and then click OK

Enter Company and Supplier on PO created above Click OK   > Add lines from receipt (if 3 way matching) / Add lines from purchase order (if 2 way watching) / Add lines from supplier contract > Scroll down to the middle of the page and click "search." Check the lines of the records that you want to add > Click OK, then Click "Complete Supplier Invoice"  Create an invoice from the workbench in order to create it directly from receipts (3 way matching) or POs (2 way matching).
task_step: 8. Create an Invoice from the Workbench

description: Invoice will run through Matching. After matching, complete any other required Approval Steps if any
Verify that you are able to select Supplier Invoice created above.  Verify that Settlement Run has been submitted for approval
Verify that Settlement Run is routing as expected for approval
Upon approval, verify that Cash and Accounts Payable accounting entries have been created as expected via related action off the Supplier Invoice Payment.
Create Purchase order for a Goods Line.  Choose any Spend Category, Quantity of 1 and Unit Cost of 100.  Submit PO for approval.
Approve Purchase Order. Test Business Process routing based on the configured conditions for each Business Process step.
Issue a purchase order and print.
All the details from the Purchase Order will be copied into the Supplier Invoice  Change the unit cost from 100 to 1000 in order to trigger a Match Exception  Submit
task_step: 4. Create a Supplier Invoice from the PO

description: The Supplier Invoice will run through matching. Match status should be "Exceptions" Verify that Match Exception was routed to the correct role.  In user's Inbox, hit the button that says "Request Match Exception Override" Specify Override Reason and then hit OK
task_step: 5. View Match Exception and request Match Exception Override

description: Verify that Match Exception Override request was routed based on setup of "Supplier Accounts Match Exception Override Event" Approve any necessary steps
task_step: 6. Approve Supplier Accounts Match Exception Override Event Business Process

description: Supplier Invoice Match Status should now be "Override"
Run integration for test File or Load via EIB

Specify Date Range for the Load you are looking for Choose Usage of Procurement  Open Credit Card Transaction File line Go to "Corporate Credit Card Accounts Processed" tab  As related Action, go to Accounting > View Accounting  Note that the Procurement Card Load generates accounting to:  DR Spend based on Credit Card setup CR Account per Credit Card Payable Posting Rule

Login as user who has loaded, unverified Procurement Card Transactions Go to Purchases Dashboard (add if not displayed) and find link to Verify Procurement Card Transactions   Select one of the items and click OK Edit Spend Category, Supplier, and Worktags as desired Click Submit
Approve Procurement Card Transaction Verification. Test Business Process routing based on the configured conditions for each Business Process step.

Find the transaction you processed above and, as a related action, go to Accounting > View Accounting  Note Accounting will be to DR the new accounting based on the Procurement Card verification values and CR will be to reverse the initial accounting posted upon loading of Card file
task_step: 5. View Accounting related to Procurement Card Transaction Verification

description: Verify that you are able to select a Procurement Card statement  Verify that Settlement Run has been submitted for approval
Verify that Settlement Run is routing as expected for approval
Upon approval, verify that CR to Cash and DR to Credit Card Payable accounting entries have been created as expected via related action off the Procurement Card payment.
Create Supplier contract with a contract type that allows manual invoices
Verify that the Contract is routing as expected for approval
Enter Company and Supplier from the contract that was create above and for contracts in the workbench
Approve Supplier Invoice. Test Business Process routing based on the configured conditions for each Business Process step.
Verify that you are able to select the Supplier Invoice created above. Verify that Settlement Run has been submitted for approval.
Verify that Settlement Run is routing as expected
Create Supplier contract using a contract type that allows manual Purchase Orders
Approve Supplier Contract. Test Business Process routing based on the configured conditions for each Business Process step.
Create Purchase Order from the Supplier Contract created above

Approve Supplier Invoice. Test Business Process routing based on the configured conditions for each Business Process step.

Verify that Settlement Run is routing as expected

Approve and Source Requisitions.  Run the Find Requisitions report.  Filter report by status of "Successfully Completed" that have unsource lines. Assess the source as needed.
Approve and Issue Purchase Orders.  Run the Find Purchase Orders report. Filter report by status to review all POs not in issued status. Assess then approve/issue as needed.
Close all applicable Issued POs to prevent further action on them. Open all applicable Closed POs to allow future action on them.

Review Supplier Contracts. If the Supplier Contract is manual, be sure to create Supplier Invoice.  If Supplier Contract is scheduled, make sure it is coming into the AP Data Entry Specialist inbox to edit.
Create Receipt Accruals. Be sure this is the last thing you do after you review Open POs and Supplier invoices. If you run too soon the reflected accrual may not be accurate.

Roll Forward Commitments and Obligations. Create procurement document roll forward events to ensure that all procurement documents not closed prior to the year old are rolled forward into the new year.

Mass Close Procurement Documents. Close unused portions of procurement documents (requisitions, purchase orders and supplier contracts) when your organization no longer needs to process procurement activities against them, such as additional receipts or supplier invoices.  If you use commitment accounting for procurement, you recover and liquidate any commitment or obligation journals and also recover obligated budget when you close procurement documents.
Review supplier data for completeness and data quality.

scenario_name: Edit Company Accounting Options related to Procurement
description: Ensure company accounting options related to procurement are configured correctly:  Procurement Tax Options:  Calculate Tax Due to Supplier Enter Tax Due to Supplier or Calculate Self Assessed Taxes
task_step: Related Action From Company > Edit Company Accounting Details > Update the Tax Option Default

description: Ensure company procurement options are configured correctly. Take special note of the following:  1) Will customer be implementing Sales Tax on Requisitions? (Enable/Disable Transaction Tax on Requisition Flag)  2) Does customer wish to hide Service lines on Requisitions? (Enable/Disable Disable Service Lines on Requisitions Flag)  3) Does customer wish to hide Project lines on Requisitions? (Enable/Disable Disable Project-Based Service Lines on Requisitions Flag)
task_step: Related Action From Company > Edit Company Procurement Options

description: Review all units of measure. Be sure to consider punchout suppliers UOM if punchout is in scope.
Make sure all cart links are accurate based on scope and instructional text is correct.
Verify instructions or links to policies for the requisition process.
Review and validate the supplier contract types and options.
Review the delivered layout and ensure the layout is configured for each company. If custom layout is in scope, review this custom layout once it is built by integrations team.
Review return reasons and identify which ones should auto-generate the invoice adjustment process.
Review the requisition types. Requisition types are used for sourcing rules or as a dimension in BP logic.
If punchout is in scope, review the punchout links once they are configured. Ensure that only the allowed users can see the link when entering a requisition.

Review the match rule set and each of the condition rules in the rule set. Ensure that there are no gaps in the rules that would enable an invoice to get through without a second set of eyes reviewing the differences between the invoice and its associated PO.
task_step: View Supplier Accounts Match Rule Set

description: Verify the following rules have the correct ledger account: Spend, Credit Card Payable, Receipt Accrual

Verify all required Custom Validations have been configured for (depending on scope): Catalog Load, Change Order, Procurement Card Transaction Verification, Purchase Order Acknowledgement, Request for Quote, Request for Quote Award, Request for Quote Response, Requisition, Return to Supplier, Supplier, Supplier Change, Supplier Contract, Supplier Contract Amendment

Confirm that these Role Based Security Roles for Procurement have been properly assigned or are defaulting to each Company (depending on scope): Buyer, Supplier Contract Specialist, Procurement Data Entry Specialist

Run User-Based Security Group Assignments report and Verify that these user Based Security Roles for Procurement have been properly assigned: Procurement Configurator, Accounts Payable Configurator, Credit Card Transaction Administrator
Verify all required Worktag Usages have been configured for: Procurement Card Transaction Verification, Purchase Order, Request for Quote, Requisition
Review the Related Worktag usage for: Purchase Item, Spend Category
